tweets.text:
Do you know how to survive a flood? Survivalist Megan Hine explains the three things you need to know üëá 

Over 5 million UK homes are at risk of flooding. Don't assume it won't happen to you.

https://t.co/CsUTBjY5Ft 

#FloodActionWeek #PrepareActSurvive

@Meg_Hine https://t.co/Bf3koSXpds

It's #FloodActionWeek!

Make it your aim to know what to do in a flood to keep yourself and the things you love safe.

üëâLearn what to do in a flood: https://t.co/yDrqZN037T

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/i10cYZkcUj

Look! @wessexwater, who last year spent 107,434 hours dumping sewage into local rivers and on 813 separate occasions dumped sewage into our seas, has just applied to the @EnvAgency for a new sewage dumping permit.

But will the EA refuse the application?

https://t.co/nl5a7W7qo0
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/OyzkQeAqy5

PS. Why does the @EnvAgency make people visit their local offices just to view these applications?

Can they not simply post them online like everyone else?

So much for openness and transparency.
@EnvAgencyAnglia That sounds like quite a small number...is that good compared to past counts?

urls.title: What to do in a flood - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
We're supporting the @EnvAgency Flood Action Campaign.

In England there are over 5 million homes at risk of flooding, with the average cost of flooding to a home standing at around ¬£30,000. 

Do you know what to do in a flood? This EA page will help you: https://t.co/M69rAjeROr https://t.co/kYoMiH24z9

Good #regulation of the #nuclear industry (+ users of radioactive substances such as hospitals) ensures that people & the environment are protected from unsafe levels of radiation.
We‚Äôve just published the annual Radioactivity in Food & Environment report: https://t.co/9QXLGmZiXJ

Did you know 5.2 million homes and businesses
in England are at risk of flooding according to the @EnvAgency

To mark #FloodActionWeek here's five things you can do that could really make a difference! https://t.co/1BFY1X8Sm3

5.2 million Homes and businesses in England are at risk of flooding.üè†üåßÔ∏è

Would you know what to do in a flood?  

Find out here https://t.co/wwueotSYc7 

#PrepareActSurvive #Floodaware https://t.co/bxRTmDU40x

Check out the 5 things you can do this #FloodActionWeek to be better prepared for a flood.

Take action to protect yourself, your family and your home now. üëá

https://t.co/PzDbHFZ82f

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/MygPPn6XQu

Delighted to be involved through @DurhamCouncil #sdg7 with support from lots of UK partners @beisgovuk @mhclg @northeastlep @AnAndrewClark @Comm1nrg @EnvAgency @DurhamComAction @DEI_Durham @aucklandproject  @Carol_VONNE @CoalAuthority https://t.co/SNLrBcVTiZ

tweets.text:
Today is the start of @EnvAgencyNW's #FloodActionWeek! ‚òîÔ∏è

For more advice on what to do in a #flood visit https://t.co/QEw9YLnULG

#PrepareActSurvive #flooding #FloodAware https://t.co/2GvlN3ebTu

Did you know. 5.2 million homes and businesses in England are at risk of flooding.

 Are you one of them? Do you know? Don‚Äôt assume it‚Äôs not you.

Check your flood risk for your home or work at: https://t.co/29saU23JrY #prepareactsurvive #FloodActionWeek üè†üåä https://t.co/SK5js60fkd
https://t.co/loNztwaUlT

As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlanet with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver the Nature Recovery Network and create better connected spaces for nature üåø https://t.co/e6wIperqa2

Today we launched a ¬£200m programme to improve the resilience of communities at risk of #flooding & coastal change. 

25 areas will be selected to receive funding to demonstrate how innovative actions can work, individually and in combination.

Read more https://t.co/Jr6aN8afJ0 https://t.co/m2XzBkSPHP

Well said Lee. 

And it‚Äôs not just @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency also have been cut to the bone. https://t.co/HYcc3fBIQs

Income from fishing licence sales in Lincs and Northants in September was ¬£1,206,923 ‚Äì a 18.10% rise on last September‚Äôs income.

This helps us improve the environment and fishing. Why not contribute by buying a licence at https://t.co/f5iTBV20kq? #Fish #Fishing https://t.co/GU0lQLmE70

Our first #CouncilsCan spotlight takes us back to February this year and the incredible joint teamwork of many Council staff to help keep the county safe and moving after Storm Dennis‚Äô effects were felt in Warwickshire. #CouncilsCan #BestWarwickshire https://t.co/7uRWuNlzqs

This is a massive problem that needs sorting urgently. There are so many good, incredibly knowledgeable and passionate people at @NaturalEngland that need to be properly rewarded and resourced in order to protect our natural heritage. 
https://t.co/DmZNHTNqUq

@GroundControlGC @GrahamBirdGC @rogerbarronGC our H@S manager giving a behaviour safety audit to our guys working for @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyMids today on the river Idle. All at a safe distance. @AngelinaSooren https://t.co/rVKnayZrEz

tweets.text:
#TeamEA are on call 24/7 to respond to environmental incidents. 

This weekend we responded to reports of a corrosive substance left in a watercourse in Burtonwood.

Seen something in a local watercourse that does not look right? Report it to us on 0800 80 70 60 https://t.co/fHae7olcub
